page.title: 13HARWELL
page.content: HARWELL RECENTLY CELEBRATED ITS MILLENIUM (1985) HAVING RECEIVED ITS CHARTER IN 985. PROFESSIONS ARE EQUALLY DIVIDED WITHIN THE COMMUNITY AMONG COMMUTERS,A.E.R.E.STAFF, FARMERS AND AGRICULTURAL LABOURERS.THERE ARE 3 FARMS IN HARWELL -KING'S,PRINCE'S AND BISHOP'S - FAMOUS FOR CHERRIES. ACTIVITIES ARE VARIED,INCLUDING TENNIS,BOWLS,STAMP- AND GARDENING CLUBS .' AUNT SALLY ' IS A POPULAR PUB GAME. ARCHITECTURE SPANS A PERIOD OF SEVERAL HUNDRED YEARS,THE OLDEST HOUSE DATING FROM 1180.THERE ARE RECORDS OF A CHAPEL(1086) AND ST.MATTHEW'S OWNS THE OLDEST SET OF 6 BELLS IN BRITAIN. IN THE 1086 DOMESDAY SURVEY,HARWELL WAS HELD BY 3 LORDS OF THE MANOR .
